snippet: Readers comment on my column about the perils of toxic stress and the importance of early-childhood interventions.
abstract: Readers comment on my column about the perils of toxic stress and the importance of early-childhood interventions.
lead_paragraph: My Sunday column looks at new evidence of the importance of early childhood and pregnancy on life outcomes. I've been increasingly impressed by the research that suggests that biological mechanisms -- such as the way cortisol floods a small child under stress, disrupting brain development -- appear to lay the groundwork for social disadvantage later. But I was looking for a peg to write about this, and then the American Academy of Pediatrics provided it by issuing a landmark policy statement endorsing this new science of toxic stress.
